alert.note: Alert for Wahkiakum (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 06 at 5:06PM PST until January 08 at 3:23AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Willapa River near Willapa affecting Pacific County. Naselle River near Naselle affecting Pacific and Wahkiakum Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Washington... Wilson River near Tillamook affecting Tillamook County. Nehalem River near Foss affecting Tillamook and Clatsop Counties. Grays River near Rosburg affecting Wahkiakum County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Grays River near Rosburg. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Above 16.0 feet, expect major flooding of lowland areas and roads in the vicinity of Hwy 4 and Rosburg. Numerous road closures are likely. Some buildings in low areas near the river are threatened with flooding above this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 PM PST Thursday the stage was near 15.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest near 16 feet later this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued later tonight.
